Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel Facility”
Reviews.Author: SEM88
Reviews.Content: Nothing bad to say about the place. Great villas with a beautiful courtyard. The rooms were great, service was great, location was great.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here, again. Though I would request a Villa room next time. Yummy cookies at check in!”
Reviews.Author: C T
Reviews.Content: The room we stayed in was spacious and all our requests.... Top floor (only have three), away from elevator, extra towels, and COOKIES (yum) were accommodated. The front desk are friendly and helpful. This property is on a golf course and driving distance to everything plus pet friendly. I have two negatives that made the room only a 3..... The walls are thin and you can hear your neighbor flushing, talking, coughing, etc. I find this to be the norm in most hotels and seems you can only avoid this by being in an empty hotel. We stayed in the main building. Maybe it's better in a Villa room. Our room was in need of some repairs... Running toilet needed a jiggle when flushed and chips on the sink faucet, otherwise clean and comfy. Wireless WIFI was weak in our room, totally inaccessible from the desk, but ok from the bed.

Reviews.Title: “Great pet friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: dab11822
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were traveling with our small dog for a family gathering in Escondido and the Doubletree Golf Resort worked out perfectly for all of our family members that came to town for our son's engagement party. The grounds are well kept, the rooms are very spacious and the hotel staff was very helpful and friendly. Great deal for the price ....

Reviews.Title: “Needs a renovation!”
Reviews.Author: FreqBizTrav123
Reviews.Content: Amenities such as a hair dryer that are standard in comparable hotels, are missing. The layout of the hotel makes it inconvenient to lug heavy luggage.

Reviews.Title: “nicest hotel staff you will ever meet”
Reviews.Author: J K
Reviews.Content: I am staying at the hotel as a hhonors diamond member. first let me say that the staff here, and I mean all of the staff are some of the best trained you will ever find. They go out of the way to make sure you are happy. The rooms and grounds are nice and well kept. compared to other properties I have stayed at in the last three years (over 150 ) this may not be the newest or fanciest. BUT you will never find a more helpful staff. rooms are clean. grounds are clean.

Reviews.Title: “Peace and Quiet from downtown”
Reviews.Author: KLBWylie_TX
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were traveling to San Diego for a short 4 day pleasure trip. The last time in SD was 40 years ago and we did not want to stay anywhere near the coast. The Doubletree Golf Resort was the perfect choice and we don't even play Golf. The hotel is not posh or elegant, but very nice with clean comfortable rooms. And the price is fantastic! The hotel rooms are all bungalow style with views of the golf course and pool. Unfortunately, most of the trees block the view because there are only 3 stories to the hotel. But we liked the privacy and the quiet was priceless. The property has lovely grounds, but no walking trails. The restaurant serves a bountiful breakfast buffet daily from 6:30 am for only $15.00, which is priced well for the available choices. Also available are a very large lap pool, a fitness center and tennis courts. Within 5 miles of the resort, we discovered Black Mountain Open Space Trails which has community parks and great hiking trails. The Resort is just off Hwy 15, so you can get anywhere in SD within 30 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, great staff, good amenities, quiet room, charge for free internet access was quickly rectified.”
Reviews.Author: Lee-is-me
Reviews.Content: Check in was a breeze and staff very pleasant. We didn't have time to check out the fitness center or play tennis or golf, but we did check it out for the future. Hotel is about 30 minutes north of San Diego and easy to get to. If in the area I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel for a great price.”
Reviews.Author: Honakeramybob
Reviews.Content: This was our third time staying at this Doubletree and we will definitely stay again. I travel with three children and the staff always makes me and my kids feel welcome, that isn't always the case at other hotels. The rooms are always clean and they are nice size rooms. The staff is always helpful and friendly. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, property needs to be updated, nice grounds, noisy from above.”
Reviews.Author: mljack99
Reviews.Content: The staff was very welcoming. They do accept pets and have nice grounds. We had a good breakfast although it isn't included. The furnishings need to be updated, wallpaper peeling in bathroom, plumbing very loud. Were up on and off all night because we could hear noise from above. Although, they weren't partying, normal movement sounded like it was in our room. Good location if you are attending Poway performing arts, which we were.

Reviews.Title: “Standard mid-range US hotel”
Reviews.Author: Coldwarrior
Reviews.Content: Standard mid-range hotel with nice yard. Breakfast ok. Good location. AC/heater very old keeping so much noice that impossible to keep on during night without using earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal, Don't Get a Bottom Floor”
Reviews.Author: gauchojoe
Reviews.Content: We received a great off-season deal that we could not pass up in our recent trip down to San Diego on Christmas break. The rooms are big in this sprawling resort site. The golf course was a little out of shape, but it was winter. There are tennis courts available for a fee, but if you are a Hilton Cards member, it is waived (at least for us it was). It was a little too cold for us to try out the pool(s). The staff was very friendly and accommodating. The only issue that we had was that we were in the bottom floor of a two story "apartment" complex. You can hear everything. The folks upstairs sound like they were bouncing off the walls, but when we checked they were simply walking around. You can hear the water turn on when someone showered, and the toilets flush. We were lucky that they were on the same timetable as us, and not rambunctious. Otherwise, this would have been a major issue. The location for the resort is a bit out of the way if you are in San Diego as a tourist. The beaches are a good half hour away (La Jolla is the closest). Downtown SD is a little more than half an hour away depending on traffic. There are many restaurants close by and a grocery store across the street if needed. The great rate we had out balanced the issue of being on a bottom floor and the location being "out of the way" for our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: twoqs
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed a week from late December to early January and were very pleased with this hotel. The room was spacious and very clean and the grounds were beautifully maintained. Our room was very quiet (even on New Year's Eve) and we certainly enjoyed our balcony overlooking the golf course. We are not golfers or tennis players, but we enjoyed the gym and the three pools, including the 4-lane lap pool. We ate breakfast there almost every morning -- the breakfast had a good variety and was adequate -- but not great. The staff was, without exception, very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “This is normally a great place to stay but . . .”
Reviews.Author: TCHarp
Reviews.Content: On this particular trip it was as if a herd of wild horses was in the room above, below, and on both sides of our room. There was screaming outside our door and outside our patio (opposite the door). I was forced to call the desk on at least 5 occasions on one evening. Finally I was told the people above us had been moved, and it got a little more quiet that evening, but it seemed as if the same folks were back the next night. The hotel staff was very understanding but told me there was little they could do as they weren't staffed to properly handle the number of unruly guests they had at the hotel these two evenings. Unfortunately, my wife got very sick while we were there(not due to the noise), but the staff was, again, very helpful and the restaurant even prepared chicken soup for her even though it wasn't on the menu. It was extremely hard to get around the noise on this stay. It was very nearly unceasing. I'm not at all sure why the hotel would allow this sort of thing to go on to such a degree. What would have normally been a very nice Thanksgiving stay turned into more of a nightmare. Unfortunately the understanding and thoughtful staff seems to have been able to do little to correct the problem this time. Normally I would rate a stay like this as very poor, but I have stayed at this hotel before and I know that this was not normal so I'm rating it somewhat higher.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: unathan1
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to this property. Both of our visits have been great. The room is clean, the property is well maintained and best of all it is quiet. We travel with our infant child and so it is important to us that the nights are quiet so that he sleeps well. We have reserved the king suite on both occasions which is nice being that he has his own room and so we can sit and watch tv or talk without waking him it. The rooms are huge (to say the least), the people are very friendly and the restaurant is nice. (sitting out on the patio watching people play golf is a great way to wake up). We will be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend getaway for San Diego wedding”
Reviews.Author: flyzapper
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for an extended weekend while attending a friend's wedding close by. The resort was relaxing and a nice weekend escape. The grounds are nice, and we enjoyed the pool and walking around the golf course near the hotel. The room was large, and had an extra sink outside of the bathroom, always a plus. The only negative about the room was the fact that in all of the smaller buildings detached from the mail building, the air conditioner is low to the floor and in the corner, pointing at the bed. This means that the corner of the room between the bed and wall is very cold, but the rest of the room is not cooled. The air conditioner should be high so the cool air gets a chance to circulate. We had the breakfast buffet included with our stay, which was nice to wake up to. It consisted of the standard eggs, potatoes, cereals, pastries, and fruit. I missed the Belgian waffle station, however, since the waffles were clearly frozen and simply warmed up and put on a heated tray. They ended up hard and inedible. The free cookies at the lobby were good, and we took one every time we walked through. This resort seems to be popular with bachelor parties/weddings because of the golf course, and can be noisy at night, depending on who your neighbors are. Overall, the resort provided a nice weekend away from Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaMapper
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, nice facility and a great location make this a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE, a relaxing find. "Glad I did" it”
Reviews.Author: johnnyvegas12
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Saturday October 1st so we could get an early start to the Chargers game the next morning. I was a bit nervous by some of the comments here but glad I did! I did request a villa, instead of the main room and glad I did. You will see "Glad I did" comes up alot. The hotel is situated on a corner that my GPS did not like to find. I drove around quite a bit, and a uturn or two later we found the place. If coming South on I-15 exit Carmel Mountain road, not Rancho Penasquitos as my GPS said. We checked in quickly and headed to an apartment or timeshare looking building 12. Room 512. I first asked for a second floor room but the villas have tiny balconies, like just to stand up on. The main building is 3 stories and has larger ones. The villas have little patios and are very large. The flat screen tv has a great picture and the furniture is great. I would not stay in a couple of the villas as they are near the busy street or the patio looks onto another unit. Building 5, 4 and 2 looked the best by far!! The pool was great, and ordered a cocktail delivered by someone from the Mulligans Pub. We ate there that night and they had very good food. Pub food, soup, etc. It was overlooking the golf course. Of course it was dark so not much to see but when the suns still up it is probably nice. All the employees from security to the operator, to the maids were great. My only complaint, and it's a small one, is the villas each dont have an ice machine or soda machine. You have to hunt for them. But that is a small issue. Will return!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: rt145996
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms were spacious and clean. Beds VERY comfortable (you almost didn't want to get up). This is one of the only places that I have seen that actually looks like the photos on the net. Great place to stay at a reasonable price. You do have to pay $10 a day for parking and $6 if you want internet in your room. (Free wi-fi in lobby, though).

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service, but no fridge!”
Reviews.Author: JLofgren
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent traveler and this is by far the best customer service experience I have had. When I first checked in, I was greeted by Bob. He was extremely helpful and made checking in a breeze! He was extremely personable as well which really set the tone for the rest of my stay. The resort itself is set up more like an apartment complex than like a standard hotel, so it took a few minutes to get your bearings straight on where everything was located. The room was very nice and clean. I had a king bed that was comfortable and the room had a separate vanity from the one in the bathroom. My only negative about this hotel is that there was not a mini fridge in the room... this made for a big dissapointment after ordering extra sushi to go from a nearby restaurant. At checkout I was helped by the multi-tasker extraordinaire, Kirk! Everyone at that resort really was attentive and helpful and truly seemed to appreciate my business there. I would highly recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you want in San Diego except the ocean”
Reviews.Author: family2shop4
Reviews.Content: Just stayed three nights for a training at PPH. The room is spacious and well planned out. Note: no fridge. The staff is friendly and helpful all hours. They have fantastic chocolate chip cookies. The golf course is pleasant and peaceful (I did not golf though). Mulligan's bar and grill has a great happy hour menu. Can't beat the burger and fries for $5, and really good potstickers, chicken quesadillas, and Caesar salad. A wonderful fitness center with a lap pool away from the rooms. A seperaye family pool for families with kids near rooms. Rooms have balconies with table and chairs and room service. Great room rated. Major chain stores nearby, a grocery store across the street, and excellent freeway access right where the 15 and 56 meet. A straight shot over to Del Mar for ocean dining and more.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: travelgirlCA1
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at the Doubletree in Mission Valley in San Diego when down that way and just love the location but this time we stayed in Northern San Diego county and I thought I would try this hotel. It is a decent price for the room-stayed in the King Villa. The room was very large, and the bed comfy. Also had two sinks which was great! Other reviews remark about the lack of a mini refrig which I agree they should have. No complaints. Love my Hilton Honors reward points.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: WeLuvItaly
Reviews.Content: My daughter recommended this to family and friends attending her wedding. It was a wonderful venue. We would expect to pay twice as much for this quality in the San Diego area. The staff was very cooperative in placing our family members in the same area. The grounds are beautifully landscaped. The rooms are large and beds are very comfortable. Highly recommend! We are returning in October.

Reviews.Title: “Our thrid time here and we will be back. Great for dog owners.”
Reviews.Author: janetdich
Reviews.Content: Spacious, nicely landscaped hotel. There are many separate buildings, each with six rooms. Rooms can connect for families who need two rooms. Only negative, walls are a little thin.... We found this hotel because it is DOG FRIENDLY. I believe they take dogs up to 50 lbs. They will even provide a dog dish, treats etc. It is very difficult to find a hotel in San Diego that allows dogs larger than 20 lbs. Another great tip for San Diego travel: While you attend a Padre's Baseball Game, Furry Tales Doggy Daycare will keep your dog for you. They stay open until 10 PM on game nights, and are only about 1-2 blocks from the stadium. My dog was very happy with her experience. Very nice staff. $20 for care during the game, 5:00 PM - 9:30PM. ( I called all the kennels and daycare places in San Diego before I found this gem.)

Reviews.Title: “Aging Property with Great Potential”
Reviews.Author: ifly747s
Reviews.Content: The hotel property is in need of rehab -- it is definitely showing it's age. The rooms were large, and the beds were quite comfortable. The fitness center pool and tennis courts were great. Tennis is $15 unless you are a Hilton Honors premium member, in which case it is free. We did not use the golf course, but it appeared to be adequate, given the property size and location. We did not have any meals at the property, so I have no comment on the restaurants. I have a few minor complaints. #1 the parking is $9.95 a day for open air, non secure parking. #2 The TV reception in the rooms is awful. The room have an HDTV, but [poor] analog reception. #3 This is actually a BIG complaint, the hotel housekeeping crew is not paying attention to cleanliness of the Hotel areas outside of the rooms. There were used room service trays outside of our room [and others] for 3 days, before they were picked up -- This is totally unacceptable!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: guida_garcia
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Doubletree Golf Resort San Diego for 10 nigths. It's a great Resort Hotel close to the Highway and local shopping. It's a quite place. The room was big, the bed was very comfortable and the room was clean. Good service. Great breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if you need to work.”
Reviews.Author: slbintx
Reviews.Content: The hotel is okay. It has some positives but there is a reason why it has an 80% recommendation. Thin walls, sound echos in the hall and from outside. I could hear 3 different conversations not occurring in my room. Internet straight from mid-1990's. No wifi in the rooms and an ethernet connection that is molasses slow. Tried to work, couldnt. Tried to download a movie. After three hours, only 6 hours more remain. Not great accuracy of information about hotel services from central reservations.

Reviews.Title: “not bad..but not great”
Reviews.Author: neptunebutch
Reviews.Content: After staying in La Jolla last year at this time, my daughter suggested I stay further inland to avoid the "June Gloom". Weather was crappy Wednesday and cleared up by Friday....not the hotel's fault. I have stayed at other hotels to visit my daughters and the fact there was no micorwave/ fridge and no free internet kind of pissed me off..and the 10.95 a day to park in an empty lot put me over the top. The room was very clean but the TV kind of sucked cause they have HD TV's but not even basic cable..so everything was kind of fuzzy....don't think I would stay there again especially when other hotels offer a lot mor free services

Reviews.Title: “As Promised, We Returned for a Second Visit”
Reviews.Author: Critics_Critic
Reviews.Content: In April (about a year after our original visit) we once again returned to the Doubletree Golf Resort (see my previous review "Best kept secret in San Diego). We were warmly greeted at the desk by the Manager, and given a great room. The room was well furnished, new carpeting, new furniture, and all the amenities you would expect. The pool was great, and we did not realize that when staying at the resort, we also had access to the Spa facilities which includes another jacuzzi and pool. We once again golfed their course (very nice course), and had a wonderful time. For a great getaway, you can't beat the Doubletree Golf Resort for facilities, staff, and price.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, wonderful service, will stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: UtahMike11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Double Tree for a family get-a-way. It has easy access to the freeway and is about 20 minutes from the city and beach. We were very impressed with the staff and the service. Everyone was very friendly and helpful. We were greeted with warm cookies on check-in that were "the best" my wife had ever had. HINT: The front desk will give you more every day if you just ask. The rooms were clean, quiet, comfortable and spacious. Ours had 2 queen beds and it had 2 separate sinks (one outside the bathroom) that made getting ready in the morning much easier. The pool was a little too chilly, but the hot tub was great. The breakfast buffet is pretty good, but probably a little over-priced. There is no fridge or microwave in the room but they are available to rent. Parking was free for Hilton Gold members and it was always easy to find a great spot. We were very impressed with this hotel and plan to return.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Golf Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Golfnut222
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 days and had a great time. The facility was excellent. We were able to get and excellent rate through Priceline. The hotel is comprised of several separate buildings and the grounds are well maintained with lots of flowers and palm trees. There is also a very nice health club with swim pools for hotel guests. We golfed 3 days, the course was in excellent condition and the green fees were reasonable. The staff at the golf course and the hotel were terrific. We would have liked a refrigerator and microwave in the room, but when we requested a fridge from the front desk, they brought one right up. We are already planning to return soon. The suburban location is just off 1-15 and only 20 minutes from all of the attractions of San Diego. Or its less than 20 minutes from the beach. A large mall is only 5 minutes away and there are many restaurants and other shops nearby. We did spend a day at Sea World (not worth the money).

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel service in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: ge02878
Reviews.Content: Mr. Kruvi The best Hilton Hotels I have ever stayed at. The staff is amazing. Actually you guys set the standard for others to follow. Every single person that I have come in contact with has been outstanding. As a matter of fact I have highly recommended your hotel to every one of my coworkers. Please express my appreciation of the fantastic service I receive from your hotel every time I stay with you. The Double tree is my hotel every time I come to San Diego because of your the people. From the front desk to the pro shop, house keeping and the restaurant. Every single person genuinely cares about making this hotel the best. The Doubbletree is the only hotel I consider when coming to San Diego

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Golf Package”
Reviews.Author: EvergreenMom
Reviews.Content: Stayed in mid-January for three nights on the "Stay and Play" package, which included unlimited golf and breakfast buffet. Stayed in one of the Villa rooms. Had an adjoining room with the friend I was traveling with. We had both gotten similar room packages, but my room was much nicer, which didn't make her feel too to good. I had a wet bar, with fridge instead of a desk, and my room had a separate vanity with sink, that hers didn't have. I was very pleased. Bedding very comfortable, room clean, loved flat screen TV. Carpet was worn and fraying where it met the floor and could use replacement. Biggest problme was noise from room above me. Forturnately , I only someone above me for one of the three nights. Every single footsetp could be heard in the creaking floor above me! They arrived back to their room at 1 am and stayed up till 3 am. And they didn't sit still. Before they went to sleep, I even go to hear the headboard banging and moaning. Was really a grim night. I can't believe what I heard. I was also not a fan of the $9 self parking charge. Breakfast buffet was ok, not spectacular and it was the exact same items every morning. No change at all. Got sick of it by day 3. Staff in both the bar and restaurant were very friendly, as was the front desk staff. Golf course package was a good value, and the course is nice, but not a gorgeous top resort course; however, I wasn't paying for gorgeous top resort course. Play on the course is VERY SLOW, which frustrates me. The first day we arrived, we had a 1:04 tee time. On Hole #2, there were four groups waiting!! That's absurd. Very rarely did we see a ranger to keep play moving alone. Day 2 and 3, we had 10 am tee times and both days, our rounds lasted just under 5 hours. That's way too long. The course is pretty, has some challenges, but is playable. It is, however, immediately adjacent to the highway and it's very loud. Was hard to hear my golfing partner during some holes. All in all, good trip for the money spent. A "value" vacation, with all the upsides and downsides of "value".

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful location”
Reviews.Author: hummingbirdUK
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel about 20 minutes drive from the centre of San Diego. The rooms are very spacious and clean and ours had a small seating area outside. Our room was in the main building opposite the pool and although the hotel was nearly full the pool area was always quiet. The hot and cold breakfast buffet was excellent, served in the restaurant overlooking the golf course. Overall a peaceful location perfectly situated for visiting San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: Mickielw
Reviews.Content: This Doubletree is nice. The room was spacious and clean. The pool, while it had a nice layout, was a little dirty. Has all the amenities you would expect from a Doubletree, but I would eat off property unless you are dead tired, because Room Service is just OK. Service runs hot and cold for the hotel in general, at times the staff seemed a little too causal and complacent. The hotel is located in a quite part of town and is across the street from a major grocery store, but you will have to get on the freeway to hit the restaurants at Carmel Mountain. Access to and from the 15 freeway is very easy and close. We didn't play golf, so I can't comment on the course, but overall our stay was enjoyable and I would return to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service and spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: Bruingirl6
Reviews.Content: I booked a room here at the last minute when left with a cat and nowhere to stay. They were more than accomadating when I called and asked about their pet policy. They stated that they usually did not have felines staying, but that it wasn't a problem. The front desk was very professional and friendly. They even remembered my cats name and told me to have a wonderful stay with "Sassy." The room was very spacious and had a small fridge. As usual, the Doubletree cookies were delicous.

Reviews.Title: “Best Kept Secret in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Critics_Critic
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Doubletree Golf Resort, and it was great. Rooms were spacious and very reasonable. Well appointed rooms, great bed, large and thick towels. Golf course is right near your room (I drove my cart to the room), and the Golf Green Fee's were very reasonable. Very nice pool. Perfect inexpensive Golf Getaway. The folks at the coffee shop are very nice, but you can do better (price wise) visiting a great assortment of restaurants just on the other side of the freeway. Would stay there again, and also golf there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: SDNX
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on two different occasions each for two nights. First time I was in the Villas which are separate buildings off to the side.The rooms are large and clean. Not the newest but had no complaints. I got a good rate and free breakfast and parking for Hilton Honors Gold members. Some of the upstairs units looked like they could be a pain to get to with heavy luggage. The second time, I was in the main building. Access to the room was via an outside hallway. There were a couple sets of stairs to navigate. If you were accessing from the parking lots, there would be more stairs to conquer. It wasn't a problem for me, but if you think it might be for you, I would check with the desk to get a room that can be accessed without stairs. Whoever designed this place was not thinking about people with luggage. There may have been elevators, but I didn't see any, and the rooms aren't on one level hallway. No problems with the room. This place covers a lot of ground. Decent pools and fitness center which was better than most hotels. I was hesitant to stay here based on some of the previous reviews, but i will be back. The rate was good and the location works for what I need.

Reviews.Title: “What a nice surprise!”
Reviews.Author: YosemiteTwo
Reviews.Content: Hotel is close to the 15 freeway. Kirk, at the front desk, was wonderful. I am very sensitive to noise but there was little traffic noise in the room - with doors closed. More noise from room guest above. Spacious 2 queen room. Super comfortable bed and pillows. Older TV. No refrigerator/microwave. $9/night parking fee. Didn't use food, golf or workout facilities. Property is starting to show some wear - rusted gating around pools, etc. but rooms were well cared for. $65 on Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy Pillows ans bed”
Reviews.Author: Sahuarita2010
Reviews.Content: The bed and pillows very comfy, the breakfast is great. Pool is tiny and nothing impresive. Golf course is great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice golf setting, worn furniture, expensive fees”
Reviews.Author: jjw77
Reviews.Content: Very nice and tranquil setting within a golf course. Freeway close yet no noise can be heard from the room. Room was spacious and clean. Lampshade and seats by the "sitting area" were worn; lampshade was so disfigured I covered it with a towel and didn't bother turning on the lamp. Front desk people are always very pleasant; this was my third stay. The breakfast buffet is pretty good, however the menu never changes so it does get old (my last stay was for 5 nights). The parking fee is outrageous so take that into consideration.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: FasTxn
Reviews.Content: The first time I stayed here the noise was the problem (Thin walls) I tried a different room this time but when someone took a shower, it sounded like they were in my room with the door open. But that wasn't what bugged me the most. When I went to take my shower, not only was there no shampoo, conditioner, etc, the only soap in the room was a piece of used soap in the tub. I called the front desk and they told me they were short handed so it would be an hour before they came to the room with replacements. As far as I know I would still be waiting as they never showed up.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel for business”
Reviews.Author: ExpTravellerOulu
Reviews.Content: The rooms are large and I have always had a clean room (I have stayed in this property dozens of nights during the past 5 years). The only disturbance is the airconditioning / heater that makes huge noice. The location is not good for sightseeing, but it is very good for my business needs. The best part of the hotel is the sports bar with good local beers and juicy hamburgers. I agree with another reviewer that it is strange to charge for parking in that location.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel, but a bit tired.”
Reviews.Author: clevelandbrad
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to this hotel at the end of August for my cousin's wedding as she was getting married at the hotel. Overall, we thought the service was excellent. The rooms were OK. The lobby felt a little "tired". The amenities were nice (the free internet in the business center was a plus) except for the fact that they charged for parking. For a hotel this far inland (you have a 1/2 hour drive to any of the city's attractions near the water) this seems a bit ridiculous. The restaurant was nothing special (typical hotel-style) but there were plenty of places within a 5-minute drive. We ate the CPK once for lunch. While we didn't play any golf, it seemed like a nice, well-groomed course. I paid $110 a night for this hotel which seemed reasonable. I would recommend this hotel, esp. if you like to play golf.

Reviews.Title: “25 miles form downtown and you charge for parking??”
Reviews.Author: twriter
Reviews.Content: I'm traveling with a team for a tournament in nearby Escondido in a couple of weeks and was looking for decent, inexpensive places to stay. I've stayed at Doubletrees before, and my research found this one, which also gets good reviews (mostly) here. I've seen what downtown "business" hotels gouge their guests who happen to have cars, assuming that they will just put the cost on their expense reports and not have to pay the fees ($30/day or more!) themselves. Hotels away from the downtown core, especially well away, I've found tend not to do this. Yet here we have an otherwise nice hotel, 25 miles away from this odious practice, charging $9/day for parking. I mean, it's bad enough when hotels charge for Internet access (although to be fair they charge less than most here), a service in the 21st century considered just another utility, the fees charged to customers almost pure profit. But this? You're out in the middle of nowhere, so anyone who goes there *has* to drive, and they get dinged with yet another added fee once you have them committed. That's poor customer service. That's abhorrent business practices. That means not only do I not spend my hard-earned money to stay there, I recommend others to stay away as well.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Berthita
Reviews.Content: Spouse, baby and I stayed here at the Doubletree and enjoyed it. The rooms are very roomy(big) & clean. Beds are big and comfy. Since we arrived the receptionist was very nice. Gave us some warm yumiieee cookies. The only thing we can say we didn't enjoy was paying an extra fee for the parking but hey if its to get treated well and sleep comfortable why not.

Reviews.Title: “Great Mother - Daughter Weekend at Doubletree Golf Resort San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Cindercyn
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I celebrated her b'day over the weekend here. Our room was upgraded to a bungalow with a pleasant "Happy B'day" and a warm cookie. We used the hotel as our base and couldn't wait to get back to the delightful beds each night. Can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Okay, Once You're In Your Room”
Reviews.Author: wynnesmom
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very outdated from the outside. The main building (lobby entrance) has a few rooms, but otherwise, you're going to have an outside entrance to your hotel room. The rooms had been updated, flat screen tvs, new duvet covers and furniture. The room was very big and had a nice balcony. The bathroom could use some updating. The hotel pool is servicable, but not upscale by any means. There are a few lounge chairs with cushions but towlels were hard to locate. The review for the hotel service was mixed. We received warm chocolate chip cookies at check-in. Yum! I needed a sewing kit and the gentleman at the front desk went the extra mile to find one for me. However, the terrace bar service was terrible. They closed early, couldn't name the wines they had available and then when we got the wine list the second server who came to take our order told us it was outdated and not correct. Location is okay. There are a bunch of chain stores and restaurants very close so if you're a business traveler looking for easy food options, this is a solid hotel. The golf course looked okay, but I'm sure there are many nicer in the San Diego area. You're still a little far from downtown, so I wouldn't recommend this hotel to someone who wanted that area to be their focal point. Overall, I paid about $200/night (including tax). I think that was significantly overpriced for the location and amenities. If I had only paid about $150 that would have been more in line with the service I received.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, as expected, big rooms”
Reviews.Author: Simm31
Reviews.Content: As you come to expect with business travel one hotel blends in to another. Great Gold course but never had time to play in 8 days (work) 20 mins to downtown San Diego which was a shame but at the time the X-rate was 2:1 so it was cheap. OK food, but eating out was better value.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay but could do better”
Reviews.Author: GP_NY
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 nights here while visiting family who lived in the area. Initially chose this location because of the convenience of the golf course on site. Did play the course once and found it to be only average, highway noise on many holes - played other courses which were much better. Hotel grounds were nicely kept, attractive locale. Rooms were decent with a villa like setting, however not as quiet as we would have liked (could hear muffled voices from adjoining rooms). Pool was nice as was the fitness center which was free for hotel patrons. Used the dining facility only once, nothing special. Parking fee seems unnecessary.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, a bit out of the way if your looking to stay closer to San Diegos main attracions and the beach”
Reviews.Author: Jaid96
Reviews.Content: I recently got sent out to San Diego on business for a month. I chose this hotel because it was the closest one to my company. The rooms are a bit rundown, but are nonetheless still comfortable and adequate for what I needed. Because I was there so long, the staff did go out of their way to make my stay more comfortable which was a plus. They gave me a refrigerator and put me closer to the front desk (which I wanted because I was a female staying alone and some of the rooms you have to walk outside to get to so I felt more comfortable staying closer to the front desk) . The hotel has 2 pools, both which are very nice!!! The internet connection at this hotel was not good at all, and allot of my other coworkers claimed they had no cell coverage in this location. This was ok for me because I was working 16 hr days and didnâ€™t really need to use the computer much from my room, but if itâ€™s a must for you, I would consider staying elsewhere. My stay came with a buffet breakfast which was pretty decent for what you pay. Overall, my stay was decent and I would stay here again on business, however if I were traveling for pleasure I would definitely stay closer to the downtown area. This hotel is about 20 mi north of all the main attractions of San Diego and traffic getting to and from the downtown area can be a bit heavy during rush hour.

Reviews.Title: “Not great, not bad, just average”
Reviews.Author: ma3usnavy
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at a Doubletree. I had always thought of the chain as relatively prestigious. This particular hotel was comfortable, but in need of updating. The wallpaper was stained and peeling and all of the furniture was visibly damaged. It was clean and comfortable and the rate was very competitive, however. It's about 20 minutes from most of the attractions in San Diego, so it is great for a quiet weekend, but not so much for checking out the nightlife or doing some heavy sightseeing unless you don't mind doing a lot of driving. Overall, not great but not bad.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, ok even if not interested in golf”
Reviews.Author: colinl
Reviews.Content: I have no interest in golf, but we chose this hotel to stop at on our way to LA as the location worked for us. The room was large and comfortable, staff were nice and in general it was a good hotel. Breakfast was not much cop though, there were 3 staff, one on the phone one working and the other telling the one who was working to do more work (in Spanish at high volume across the dinning room). There are several stores close by to guy any food, books or anything else you might want. We were in the main building, there were others so cant comment on these. Car park was quite small so if you have a large motor you will need to be good with the steering wheel.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected...”
Reviews.Author: melch65
Reviews.Content: You hear "Golf Resort" and you think....Wow!!!! The "wow's" started at check-in. First. $7 to park your car. Yes....they charge you $7 a night to park your car in the open parking lot on top of the room rate. Second. The rooms are run down and the air conditioning is loud as hell. Did I mention that the rooms are rundown. paint peeling, rust stains in the bath, old carpet, and a slider that almost took two of us to open/close. I just came from a Mariott the night prior and I guess I was spoiled. fridge in the room and breakfast in the morning. So in a nutshell....Find a Mariott and enjoy. Stay at Double Tree is you want to golf. Oh yeah...I forgot. They give you a nice warm stale cookie when you check-in. I guess they are trying to keep your mind off the parking fees.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - Clean, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Slavik401k
Reviews.Content: I booked a King Size room on the first floor. The inside looked newly renovated. Everything was clean, bathroom was nice with marble floors, and the room was huge. They could've probably fit another king or queen bed in there. One suggestion is that they add a fridge. I went without it and got a mini cooler but a fridge is much more convenient. The grounds were clean and the view of the golfcourse was amazing. I loved drinking my coffee on the patio overlooking the greens. The location was very convenient, right off the highway. And the staff at the front desk were very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “A tranquil sanctuary located right off the freeway -- Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Gnillob802
Reviews.Content: I was amazed how a tranquil setting can be created right off a freeway when there is enough land and terrain, the proper landscaping, a series of smaller buildings spread apart with open space (landscaping, water features, birds, etc...) between, and a beautiful golf course buffering the noise from the cars. The resort is located right off a major freeway intersection (Hwy 15 - sort of a route 66 for the San Diego to Las Vegas travelers and Rte 56 which links the east half of San Diego with the west half that runs along Hwy. 5). On the other side of Hwy 15 directly across from the resort is a large outdoor shopping complex with just about every familiar store and restaurant. Right across the street from the hotel is an Albertson's grocery store, 7-11 and Office Depot. The golf course is set alongside Hwy 15 and the resort itself is set down the hill a bit with views of the mountains so you forget you are in an urban area. I don't play golf so I won't comment on its merits except it looked nice from the restaurant and bar. The resort is sprawling and you have to stroll outdoors up and/or down steps to the Fitness Center, etc...(it is a golf/health resort in San Diego), but with the big shady trees, landscaped walks and gentle breezes, strolling the resort is a welcomed treat for tourist or businessman. The pools and whirlpool were surrounded by large shade trees. I can't believe some people were complaining about leaves and flower petals (actually red bouganvilla which has to be the offical flower of San Diego, its everywhere) that would fall around or into the pool, everyone I talked to thought it was like an island paradise. Everything seemed to be nestled into its own niche up and away from noise and traffic and parking. For those complaining about carrying your bags a little further to one of the niches or up stairs, well stop complaining, it means you're out of shape and you've come to the right place. If you are handicapped or elderly, there are rooms close to elevators and parking but still with a secluded feeling. I also want to mention there were church services at the hotel in a separate building and another church across the street (sorry don't remember which ones).

Reviews.Title: “Top notch doubletree”
Reviews.Author: scwretired
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at this resort and weren't disappointed about anything. We bought the bed and breakfast package for $116 and it was a buffet breakfast that was available for three hours each morning. Internet was complimentary, work out facility and pools were great and the room was very comfortable. We had two comfortable chairs to relax in while reading the morning paper that was delivered. The bed was comforable, we had a balcony to sit out on and the ammenties in the bath were nice. This is one of the nicer doubletrees we've stayed at in the past several years. Make sure you ask for a room on the first floor if possible because it's all outside corriders and you have to weave around quite a bit depending on your room. Ours was very convient but our friends had a trek to the breakfast and golf shop. SCWRetired

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, would go back.”
Reviews.Author: tavo82
Reviews.Content: Very nice environment to stay in. Staff excellent, on-site facilities great, nice sized room and very clean. Warm cookie on arrival. Would be a great place for business conference. Our original plan was to find a new place to stay for our final night in San Diego, but we stayed at the golf course an extra night instead

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable Rooms”
Reviews.Author: waiomaogirl
Reviews.Content: I won this 3* hotel through Priceline for a rate of $62/night. I stayed one night in March 2008. This hotel is located off of I-15 in Rancho Bernardo. We have no problem finding the hotel and check-in was easy and fast. We were assigned a room in bldg 16. It is a little bit of a walk from the parking lot, but it wasn't too bad. We had a room on the second floor. It was big and spacious with a king bed. There were three sinks in the room. One inside the bathroom along with the toilet and bathtub. Another is outside of the bathroom. There is a sink in the bedroom area as well with plenty of counterspace along with a coffee machine. The hotel is about a 20-30 minute drive from the airport and about a 20 minute drive to the Wild Animal Park. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone, especially at the great price I got through Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and above average”
Reviews.Author: RAGBRAI_rocks
Reviews.Content: The hotel grounds, including the golf course and outdoor pool area are spacious, clean, and beautiful; many rooms have small balconies that overlook. We chose this hotel for the golfing convenience, the course was nice. While visiting SanDiego and staying in a different hotel we also visited the Zoo, SeaWorld, and local vineyards. This hotel is pretty close to the Wild Animal Park and a few vineyards (which offer tours and wine tasting's), and it worked out nice to switch to this hotel toward the end of our week in SanDiego, to be closer to these. The rooms were clean and beds were extremely comfortable, a nice bonus was the two vanities and sinks. The pool and hot tub were relaxing and warm, which was much appreciated during this unusally cold, frosty & snowy February day in SanDiego. The front desk staff and other hotel staff were friendly, not high on the knowlegeable/helpful factor...but nice. Since it was so cold we were looking for indoor alternate options for fun, and hotel staff seriously had no concept of how to help. Luckily for us, it warmed up the next day. This hotel is pretty much off the beaten path, there is a restaurant onsite and room service, but for alternate options plan to drive for restaurants and entertainment. Overall it's a very nice place to stay for a few nights, and even better when you get a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, comfortable beds, beautiful grounds”
Reviews.Author: usa_traveller_2007
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel - much more resort-like than your average Doubletree. Of course because it is a Doubletree, you'll get the Sweet Dreams bed (and thus an incredible nights sleep) and warm chocolate chip cookies! My room was spotless, had a balcony with a great view and free wireless Internet. The furniture was in extremely good condition, looking almost brand new. The hotel's grounds and golf course are very well kept, and the pool is large, clean and bathed in shade from palm trees. I did not eat or drink in the hotel so cannot comment on the quality of the restaurant or bar. The room service menu was however quite reasonably priced. This really is a nice hotel, and I would recommend that anybody visiting the area stays here. Note that the hotel isn't really near San Diego (it's 15-20 miles out), so if visiting to tour the city you probably would find the location inconvenient. For somebody touring the mountains or the coast though, it's great.

Reviews.Title: “What a Nice Surprise”
Reviews.Author: peargigi
Reviews.Content: After searching the area for a weekend getaway place to stay with my family, I came across this resort. I was intrigued by the pictures on the web and by the amenities offered. I decided to spend a few more dollars a night to stay at this "resort" instead of your standard road side hotel. The rate I booked actually was not very expensive in my opinion. At first when we arrived I was a little disappointed. Because we didn't arrive until night we got put in an outlying building right on top of the main road/highway. Not to mention with 3 kids it was a little hike to get to the room with all of our luggage too. Having said that, we called down to the front desk to ask about our location. The staff was very friendly and helpful and explained that the hotel was completely booked but that they would move us to a different room in the morning. In the morning we left all of our things packed up and the staff moved our luggage while we were out at the parks. When we got back to the room, we were happy to see we had a much better location with no road noise and a view of nice landscaping and the pool. The hotel itself is huge and is set up almost like an apartment complex. There are walkways that lead to your own entrance to your room. Our room had 2 queen beds, a sitting area, a balcony, and a nice bathroom with 2 sinks. The room was a good size; with plenty of room for all of our kids, a roll away, a pack and play, and all of our luggage we were still able to move around comfortably. The beds are extremely comfortable and they even give you warm cookies when you check in. They have a nice heated pool and a jacuzzi area that my kids loved spending time in after a day at the parks. There is also a fitness area, another lap pool, onsite restaurant and a golf course but we didn't use any of that. As far as the location, it is a bit away from major attractions (about 25 minutes to Sea World, 30 minutes to the zoo and downtown), but in my opinion, well worth it! The room and hotel itself were nice enough that we actually wanted to spend time there. Right across the highway from the resort is a nice area with plenty of restaurants, grocery stores, gas stations, etc. If you can find a good rate for this hotel, my advice would be to book it!

Reviews.Title: “What a Beautiful Place This Is”
Reviews.Author: Forest20851
Reviews.Content: The grounds here are huge, and it's difficult to see the entire place at once. Nevertheless, on Labor day weekend, there was at least one wedding reception being catered, there was golf being played on the hotel's associated 18-hole course, and there were sun-worshippers in two different swimming pools. And since it was also 100 degrees most of the weekend, many were inside with their air-conditioning cranked up. It's a very quiet place -- everyone seems to respect everyone else's privacy. The layout of the grounds is unusual. First off there is a lodge of modern construction where you can room if you choose. Then there are 20 small two-story villa-like buildings -- each one divided into either six or eight suites--each suite with its own entrance door. One reviewer below was correct that if your villa is located far from the parking lots, you have quite a way to cart your luggage. Also, the villas have no elevators, so if your suite is on the second floor, you also cart your luggage up the steps (that's very European!). By the way, parking here is $8 a night -- more if you require a valet. My suite appears to have been closed up for some time and smelled musty, so I invested in a bottle of Fabreze at a local convenience store which took care of the problem. Otherwise, everything seemed to be in working order. There was an extensive room-service menu in my room, but I wound up eating out every night -- there are excellent restaurants in several nearby shopping centers. I was on the second floor of villa #19. I did take some photos which should be attached to this review.

Reviews.Title: “Rudeness Rampant at the DoubleTree”
Reviews.Author: YPgal
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the DoubleTree on a business trip to San Diego. I did my research on Trip Advisor and thought that the DoubleTree may be a good value. The hotel is older with outdoor hallways but the rooms are not easily assessible from the parking lots (probably good for safety, but bad for convenience). The service at the hotel was awful. I had two packages sent to the hotel that I needed for my convention. When I checked in, I confirmed that they received my packages. When I asked for them the next day, they gave me one and had an awful time locating the second. The staff, especially Elani at the front desk, was rude and seemed like I was putting them out by asking them to do their job. To top off all the rudeness, they messed up my bill and I had to call back after I checked out to get a receipt with the correct amount that was charged to my card faxed to me. I will definately not stay at this hotel again. Spend a little bit more money and stay at a nicer hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tinkerbell17
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nestled near the mountains and away from the hustle and bustle of downtown San DIego. Its about a 20 min ride to all the main attractions, but it was well worth it. My fiance and son and I stayed here bc it was centered between Downtown San Diego and Carlsbad, which is where Legoland is located. The rooms were clean, the beds were to die for. So comfortable!! The staff was very friendly. We didnt have any problems with this hotel. The parking spots were a little crammed, but that seems to be the norm everywhere in San Diego. Perhaps the one thing they could have done to make the stay "perfect", was a little better upkeep of the pool and Hot Tub. Although leaves and flowers are unavoidable... there could have been staff on hand to clean it up. I recommend this hotel for everyone. Its quiet, clean, and absolutely beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Golf For a Great Price!”
Reviews.Author: SouthDakotaGolfer
Reviews.Content: I hadn't been to San Diego in 20 years. It was great to see that Rancho Bernardo hadn't changed much. This hotel is awesome, the service people are super friendly. The rooms are spacious and clean. I coudnt find a thing to complain about, ok maybe the parking fee but all in all a great location and hotel to get anywhere we needed to go. HP Sioux Falls, South Dakota

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: hyelala
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night here. One of the best hotels I've stayed at in San Diego. This hotel however is in the middle of nowhere and to get to the tourist section of San Diego you have to drive a good 15 min. But for the savings and quality it's deffinitly worth it. Great pool with movies at night for the kids. Huge property located on a golf course. The room we had was huge and we only paid $129. It had a huge sitting area, Fridge, Coffee Maker, 3 sinks, a balcony and we were able to park very close to our room. There is a supermarket right across the street along with a 7-11, gas stations, and several places to eat and a movie theater within a mile. Great Hotel and would deffinitly stay here again. It's sometimes hard to get an opening due to the exceptional value.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice small golf resort”
Reviews.Author: Markmom18
Reviews.Content: The weekend of May 5th my husband and I drove down from the Pasadena area to the Doubletree Golf Resort. I had made reservations about 2 weeks prior using the Hilton Reservations web site. Our rate, with taxes came to about $128. Which turned out to be a great bargain! Our room was located in Villa 11, Room 415. The ground floor room was nicely decorated in soft natural colors. Two comfy wing back type chairs, small table, work station, very comfortable bed with nice linens. I especially liked the wooden shutters over the windows. It gave the room a homey feel...not just a 'hotel' room. The sliding glass doors opened up to a small semi-private patio area where we watched little bunnies hop around and eat. And, of course, we had the golf course grassy area right there. Those with small children might enjoy these rooms. As others have noted, the walls are a bit thin. Our neighbors to the left and right were not noisy, but we did notice they were there..nothing terrible though. It wouldn't stop us from going back. We arrived at about 9:30am and we truly were surprised that our room was ready...that's a first! We put our luggage away, had an ok breakfast buffet at the club house restaurant and then set off for our 11:30 tee time. I've only been playing golf for 5 months now, but I had a terrific time!! After our round of golf, we headed over to the bar for a cold drink and then we went to Harrah's Casino for a bit of gambling. The Doubletree is a nicely laid out 'resort' , the pool and jacuzzi we will have to use on a return visit. The hotel staff were very pleasant folks. The grounds, public areas, and rooms were kept in very nice shape, obviously, a good crew all around works here keeping up the place! We've stayed at Paradise Point in San Diego on two prior weekend visits to the San Diego area. True we had the Bay and more bells and whistles at the PP, but we also paid $$$. This particular Doubletree is really,as they say, a "hidden gem", we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for the price”
Reviews.Author: Graham2109
Reviews.Content: We came to San Diego for a wedding and stayed at the Doubletree Golf for 5 nights over the new year period. We are a family of 7 and took two double rooms to keep the cost down. The rooms were spacious, with two large double beds and a sitting area. It is close to the 15 freeway and most rooms overlook the golf course. There are two huge swimming pools and membership of the excellent fitness centre is free to Hilton Gold members. It is advisable to ask for rooms close to the reception, otherwise it can be a long walk to breakfast, which is served in the Golf Club building. Breakfast was a buffet, and was somewhat chaotic on the days the hotel was busy. Strangely on New year's day, it was empty! I have to say we have never seen so many overweight people piling their plates high with all manner of high-cholesterol foodstuffs, sometimes smothered with maple syrup which was literally running off the sides of their plates!!! Overall, we thought the hotel was great value, although the heavy traffic in the area can mean quite a long journey time to attractions such as Sea World and downtown San Diego.

HotelInfo.Name: DoubleTree by Hilton Golf Resort San Diego
HotelInfo.Address: 14455 Penasquitos Dr., San Diego, CA 92129-1603
